dandelion.tools.generate_networkÂ¶

dandelion.tools.generate_network(self, key=None, clone_key=None, min_size=2, downsample=None, verbose=True, locus=None, **kwargs)[source]Â¶

Generates a Levenshtein distance network based on full length VDJ sequence alignments for heavy and light chain(s). The distance matrices are then combined into a singular matrix.

Parameters

  • data (Dandelion, DataFrame, str) â Dandelion object, pandas DataFrame in changeo/airr format, or file path to changeo/airr file after clones have been determined.

  • key (str, optional) â column name for distance calulations. None defaults to âsequence_alignment_aaâ.

  • clone_key (str, optional) â column name to build network on.

  • min_size (int) â For visualization purposes, two graphs are created where one contains all cells and a trimmed second graph. This value specifies the minimum number of edges required otherwise node will be trimmed in the secondary graph.

  • downsample (int, optional) â whether or not to downsample the number of cells prior to construction of network. If provided, cells will be randomly sampled to the integer provided. A new Dandelion class will be returned.

  • verbose (bool) â whether or not to print the progress bars.

  • locus (str, optional) â Mode of data. Accepts one of âigâ, âtr-abâ or âtr-gdâ. None defaults to âigâ.

  • **kwargs â additional kwargs passed to options specified in networkx.drawing.layout.spring_layout.

Returns

Return type

Dandelion object with .distance, .edges, .layout, .graph initialized.
